Key Match Events: Utah Jazz secured a 105-92 road win over the Orlando Magic.
Brice Sensabaugh dropped 27 points on 11-of-19 from the field, leading Utah's bench with 10 points in the first half.
Walker Kessler had six points and 12 rebounds in the first half, setting the tone for the road team.
Pre-Game Insights: Both squads were significantly shorthanded on Sunday night, with several starters on both sides missing the game.
Jazz head coach Will Hardy emphasized the importance of maintaining a level head and relying on the hot hand of Brice Sensabaugh.
Post-Match Reflections: Hardy added, 'I thought everybody who went in the game had moments. That’s what a team is and that’s what we want to be.'
Sensabaugh said, 'I’m just making the right reads and playing simple.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Magic got 12 points off the bench in the third quarter to keep things close.
Orlando's bench wasn't as productive in the first half (18 points).
